definition: to ban (narcotics, a movie etc)/to block (a road etc)/(Internet) to block (a user)
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters

sentences.english: The closed-door policy of the Qing dynasty closed people's visions and minds.
sentences.chinese: 閉關鎖國政策封禁了人們的眼界和思想。

sentences.english: It is prohibited to settle incomers within the range of the sealed conservation areas of the desertified land.
sentences.chinese: 禁止在沙化土地封禁保護區範圍內安置移民。

sentences.english: Relocation of immigrants in enclosed and forbidden reserves of desertified land is prohibited.
sentences.chinese: 禁止在沙化土地封禁保護區範圍內安置移民。

sentences.english: A new battle against drugs on the borders has started.
sentences.chinese: 邊境線上，毒品封禁的新一輪戰役再次打響。

sentences.english: Sysops may also block new user accounts that make lots of disruptive edits.
sentences.chinese: 管理員有權封禁多次進行擾亂性編輯的新帳號。

sentences.english: Last, the ban policy of population contradicted the policy of lifting the ban of population.
sentences.chinese: 最後，清廷對蒙地人口封禁政策與其弛禁政策相矛盾。

definition: title granted to a person (archaic)/to ban an (online) account
to screen/to block (sth or sb)/to shield/(protective) shield
to steal (including identity theft, credit card fraud or theft of computer account)/to misappropriate
